729531f-c.title: Richmond: Rockland Avenue - Richmond Avenue
729531f-c.text:
(1)
Rockland Avenue, north side, 600 yards east of Richmond Avenue
(vantage point), showing the lane that runs north from Rockland
Avenue into the property of Charles H. Blair. The lane is
popularly known as Corson's Lane, after Corson who owned the
property prior to Blair. In the background is visible the
farmhouse.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr  November 2, 1922
NO REPRODUCTIORS
(2)
A closer view of the farmhouse.
November 2, 1922
P. L. Spcrr
NO REPRODUCTIO1iS
(3)
A later view of the lane and farmhouse. The house is
500 yards north of Rockiand Avenue.
JuneWo. 1926
L. Sperr
NO EEPRODUCTIONS

729530f-a.title: Richmond: Rockland Avenue - Richmond Avenue
729530f-a.text:
Rockland Avenue, north side, about 350 yards east
of Richmond Avenue. The house and property was owned by
Adam Martin Sr. from 1898 to 1907, and by Herman Weiseman
in 1917. Dates refer to maps on whih the owners' names appear.
May 19, 1932
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729530f-a.folder: Rockland Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729536f-b.title: Richmond: Rockland Avenue - Richmond Avenue
729536f-b.text:
Rockland Avenue, north side, 600 yards east of
Richmond Avenue. This farmhouse is situated 500 yards back
of the avenue, on the lane--popularly known as Corson's
Lane--running into the Charles H. Blair propehty, formerly
owned by Corson. The lane is opposite the old Oscar Prall
House.
July 18, 1926
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
The same, another view.
June 20, 1926
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
